member.remarks: If there are any handlers subscribing the reboot will happen only after all handlers complete their execution, no matter the time that takes. In case the developer want's to set a timeout for those to complete, use the alternative call and set an execution constrain.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Runtime.Native.ConstraintException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an action is attempted that violates a constraint.
member.remarks: When a ConstraintException exception is caught, if the object that caused this exception has not been uninstalled, the catch block implementation has a small additional amount of time during which to handle the exception. If this takes too long, the exception is re-thrown automatically.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Runtime.Native.ExecutionConstraint.Install(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a sub-thread within the calling thread, containing a constraint that requires the calling thread to complete an operation within a specified time period and at a specified priority level.
member.param: The number of milliseconds before a exception is thrown. Note that the value -1 in this parameter indicates that the current constraint exception is to be uninstalled.
The priority level of the calling thread.
member.remarks: If the specified timeout expires before the thread has completed the operation, a exception is thrown. Note that the time that was set in the timeout parameter is standard clock time, not thread execution time. The priority level can only be raised for threads that already have a priority level higher than 0 (zero).
member.exception: The timeout parameter is less than -1.
The system is unable to identify the thread that is installing this constraint.
The thread installing this constraint does not own the sub-thread that the constraint applies to.
